name: Trimipramine
summary: Trimipramine is a tricyclic antidepressant used to treat depression, with sedative properties that may also benefit patients with insomnia.
description: Trimipramine, marketed under the brand name Surmontil, is a tricyclic antidepressant (TCA) with strong sedative and anxiolytic effects. Unlike many TCAs, its antidepressant activity may be partly independent of classic monoamine reuptake inhibition. It is used for the treatment of major depressive disorder and may also be prescribed off-label for insomnia, especially in depressed patients. Trimipramine has strong histamine H1 receptor antagonism and alpha-adrenergic blocking properties, contributing to its sedative effects and side effect profile.

contraindications: Hypersensitivity to trimipramine or other TCAs
Concurrent MAOI use or within 14 days of discontinuation

sections.text: Believed to enhance monoaminergic neurotransmission and antagonize histamine H1, serotonin 5-HT2, and alpha-adrenergic receptors, producing antidepressant and sedative effects.

adult.oral: Depression: Start 75 mg/day in divided doses or as a single bedtime dose; may increase gradually to 150–200 mg/day. Insomnia (off-label, low dose): 25–50 mg at bedtime.

geriatric.oral: Start at 25–50 mg/day; titrate slowly based on response and tolerability.

sections.text: Antidepressant effects may take 2–4 weeks; sedative effects occur within hours.

other: May cause QT prolongation and arrhythmias; caution in cardiac disease
Increased risk of suicidal thoughts in young adults
Anticholinergic effects may be pronounced in elderly patients

sections.pregnancy: Use only if potential benefit justifies risk; TCAs cross placenta
sections.lactation: Excreted in breast milk; use caution
sections.geriatrics: Increased sensitivity to anticholinergic and cardiovascular effects

sections.text: Gradually reduce dose over several weeks to prevent withdrawal symptoms.

items: Markedly sedating; may be useful for depressed patients with insomnia
Lower doses are effective for sleep without significant antidepressant effect
Monitor closely in elderly patients due to anticholinergic and cardiac risks
